qas.question: In what year did Apple face multiple intellectual property lawsuits?
What did the 2005 lawsuits accuse Apple of doing?
What other companies were named in the suit filed by Pat-rights?
On whose behalf did Pat-rights take Apple to court?
Which company sued Apple for breach of a "music jukebox" patent in 2005?
Which Apple technology did Pat-rights complain breached their patent in a lawsuit?

context: In <a0_0>2005<a0_0/>, Apple faced two lawsuits claiming <a1_0>patent infringement<a1_0/> by the iPod line and its associated technologies: <a4_0>Advanced Audio Devices<a4_0/> claimed the iPod line breached its patent on a "music jukebox", while a Hong Kong-based IP portfolio company called Pat-rights filed a suit claiming that Apple's <a5_0>FairPlay<a5_0/> technology breached a patent issued to inventor <a3_0>Ho Keung Tse<a3_0/>. The latter case also includes the online music stores of <a2_0>Sony, RealNetworks, Napster, and Musicmatch<a2_0/> as defendants.
